item.title: Kerb by tree outside of No. 31 Oval road, 21st August
item.description:
The kerb outside of no. 31 next trip the tree has settled in a way that pops car tyres, which has happened to me today. Due to the tree pushing the kerb outward to a point, the angle and cut of the kerb sits in a way that when attempting to park in the box, the tyre catches and pinches and pops the tyre. Literally today is the 3rd time this has happened to me personally at this specific location; I'm aware of it it and trying to park sensibly, yet my tyre is damaged - exclusively due to the way this kerb has set. I'd imagine simply rounding the edge out would help. Because the kerb directly around the tree is new, the edge is at quite a sharp angle. Either way the current layout is damaging my car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Oval Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Updates residence,Leaseholders,tenants,family,friends,visitors,football fans, you're authority Hackney Council London borough of hackney have made Osborne Road garages free parking for everyone no parking tickets, no enforcement at Osborne Road garages no need to buy E permits or book vouchers because the parking is free for everyone 24/7 Hackney council's new policy free parking marvelous causing ASB. Shame they don't make the whole of Hackney like this free parking only when it suits them., 20th August

item.title: The tenant of 25 Trowbridge Road is allowing fellow friend drug users crackheads in the building late at night at 22:50pm doing drugs. I was entering the block trying to head to my property and was disturbed by what I was seeing. This is been going on for sometime now if someone could please address this anti-social behavior., 20th August
item.description:
